definition:
Let $k$ be a field, $V$ a vector space over $k$, and $T\colon V\to V$ a
linear operator. We say that a subspace $W$ of $V$ is $T$-*admissible*
if

1.  $W$ is a $T$ - invariant subspace;

2.  If $f \in k[X]$ (See the polynomial ring definition) and
    $f(T)x \in W$, there is a vector $y \in W$ such that $f(T)x=f(T)y$.
